00159   /* Used for temp variables */
00160 #define BN_CTX_NUM  32
00161 #define BN_CTX_NUM_POS  12
00162   struct bignum_ctx {
00163     int tos;
00164     BIGNUM bn[BN_CTX_NUM];
00165     int flags;
00166     int depth;
00167     int pos[BN_CTX_NUM_POS];
00168     int too_many;
00169   } /* BN_CTX */ ;

00172   /*
00173    * BN_window_bits_for_exponent_size -- macro for sliding window mod_exp functions
00174    *
00175    *
00176    * For window size 'w' (w >= 2) and a random 'b' bits exponent,
00177    * the number of multiplications is a constant plus on average
00178    *
00179    *    2^(w-1) + (b-w)/(w+1);
00180    *
00181    * here  2^(w-1)  is for precomputing the table (we actually need
00182    * entries only for windows that have the lowest bit set), and
00183    * (b-w)/(w+1)  is an approximation for the expected number of
00184    * w-bit windows, not counting the first one.
00185    *
00186    * Thus we should use
00187    *
00188    *    w >= 6  if        b > 671
00189    *     w = 5  if  671 > b > 239
00190    *     w = 4  if  239 > b >  79
00191    *     w = 3  if   79 > b >  23
00192    *    w <= 2  if   23 > b
00193    *
00194    * (with draws in between).  Very small exponents are often selected
00195    * with low Hamming weight, so we use  w = 1  for b <= 23.
00196    */
00197 #if 1
00198 #define BN_window_bits_for_exponent_size(b) \
00199         ((b) > 671 ? 6 : \
00200          (b) > 239 ? 5 : \
00201          (b) >  79 ? 4 : \
00202          (b) >  23 ? 3 : 1)
00203 #else
00204   /* Old SSLeay/OpenSSL table.
00205    * Maximum window size was 5, so this table differs for b==1024;
00206    * but it coincides for other interesting values (b==160, b==512).
00207    */
00208 #define BN_window_bits_for_exponent_size(b) \
00209         ((b) > 255 ? 5 : \
00210          (b) > 127 ? 4 : \
00211          (b) >  17 ? 3 : 1)
00212 #endif
00213 
00214 
00215 
00216   /* Pentium pro 16,16,16,32,64 */
00217   /* Alpha       16,16,16,16.64 */
00218 #define BN_MULL_SIZE_NORMAL         (16)    /* 32 */
00219 #define BN_MUL_RECURSIVE_SIZE_NORMAL        (16)    /* 32 less than */
00220 #define BN_SQR_RECURSIVE_SIZE_NORMAL        (16)    /* 32 */
00221 #define BN_MUL_LOW_RECURSIVE_SIZE_NORMAL    (32)    /* 32 */
00222 #define BN_MONT_CTX_SET_SIZE_WORD       (64)    /* 32 */
00223 
00224 #if !defined(OPENSSL_NO_ASM) && !defined(OPENSSL_NO_INLINE_ASM) && !defined(PEDANTIC)
00225   /*
00226    * BN_UMULT_HIGH section.
00227    *
00228    * No, I'm not trying to overwhelm you when stating that the
00229    * product of N-bit numbers is 2*N bits wide:-) No, I don't expect
00230    * you to be impressed when I say that if the compiler doesn't
00231    * support 2*N integer type, then you have to replace every N*N
00232    * multiplication with 4 (N/2)*(N/2) accompanied by some shifts
00233    * and additions which unavoidably results in severe performance
00234    * penalties. Of course provided that the hardware is capable of
00235    * producing 2*N result... That's when you normally start
00236    * considering assembler implementation. However! It should be
00237    * pointed out that some CPUs (most notably Alpha, PowerPC and
00238    * upcoming IA-64 family:-) provide *separate* instruction
00239    * calculating the upper half of the product placing the result
00240    * into a general purpose register. Now *if* the compiler supports
00241    * inline assembler, then it's not impossible to implement the
00242    * "bignum" routines (and have the compiler optimize 'em)
00243    * exhibiting "native" performance in C. That's what BN_UMULT_HIGH
00244    * macro is about:-)
00245    *
00246    *                                      <appro@fy.chalmers.se>
00247    */
00248 # if defined(__alpha) && (defined(SIXTY_FOUR_BIT_LONG) || defined(SIXTY_FOUR_BIT))
00249 #  if defined(__DECC)
00250 #   include <c_asm.h>
00251 #   define BN_UMULT_HIGH(a,b)   (BN_ULONG)asm("umulh %a0,%a1,%v0",(a),(b))
00252 #  elif defined(__GNUC__)
00253 #   define BN_UMULT_HIGH(a,b)   ({  \
00254     register BN_ULONG ret;      \
00255     asm ("umulh %1,%2,%0"   \
00256          : "=r"(ret)        \
00257          : "r"(a), "r"(b));     \
00258     ret;            })
00259 #  endif                        /* compiler */
00260 # elif defined(_ARCH_PPC) && defined(__64BIT__) && defined(SIXTY_FOUR_BIT_LONG)
00261 #  if defined(__GNUC__)
00262 #   define BN_UMULT_HIGH(a,b)   ({  \
00263     register BN_ULONG ret;      \
00264     asm ("mulhdu    %0,%1,%2"   \
00265          : "=r"(ret)        \
00266          : "r"(a), "r"(b));     \
00267     ret;            })
00268 #  endif                        /* compiler */
00269 # elif defined(__x86_64) && defined(SIXTY_FOUR_BIT_LONG)
00270 #  if defined(__GNUC__)
00271 #   define BN_UMULT_HIGH(a,b)   ({  \
00272     register BN_ULONG ret,discard;  \
00273     asm ("mulq  %3"     \
00274          : "=a"(discard),"=d"(ret)  \
00275          : "a"(a), "g"(b)       \
00276          : "cc");           \
00277     ret;            })
00278 #   define BN_UMULT_LOHI(low,high,a,b)  \
00279     asm ("mulq  %3"     \
00280         : "=a"(low),"=d"(high)  \
00281         : "a"(a),"g"(b)     \
00282         : "cc");
00283 #  endif
00284 # endif                         /* cpu */
00285 #endif                          /* OPENSSL_NO_ASM */
00286 
00287 /*************************************************************
00288  * Using the long long type
00289  */
00290 #define Lw(t)    (((BN_ULONG)(t))&BN_MASK2)
00291 #define Hw(t)    (((BN_ULONG)((t)>>BN_BITS2))&BN_MASK2)
00292 
00293   /* This is used for internal error checking and is not normally used */
00294 #ifdef BN_DEBUG
00295 # include <assert.h>
00296 # define bn_check_top(a) assert ((a)->top >= 0 && (a)->top <= (a)->dmax);
00297 #else
00298 # define bn_check_top(a)
00299 #endif
00300 
00301   /* This macro is to add extra stuff for development checking */
00302 #ifdef BN_DEBUG
00303 #define bn_set_max(r) ((r)->max=(r)->top,BN_set_flags((r),BN_FLG_STATIC_DATA))
00304 #else
00305 #define bn_set_max(r)
00306 #endif
00307 
00308   /* These macros are used to 'take' a section of a bignum for read only use */
00309 #define bn_set_low(r,a,n) \
00310     { \
00311     (r)->top=((a)->top > (n))?(n):(a)->top; \
00312     (r)->d=(a)->d; \
00313     (r)->neg=(a)->neg; \
00314     (r)->flags|=BN_FLG_STATIC_DATA; \
00315     bn_set_max(r); \
00316     }
00317 
00318 #define bn_set_high(r,a,n) \
00319     { \
00320     if ((a)->top > (n)) \
00321         { \
00322         (r)->top=(a)->top-n; \
00323         (r)->d= &((a)->d[n]); \
00324         } \
00325     else \
00326         (r)->top=0; \
00327     (r)->neg=(a)->neg; \
00328     (r)->flags|=BN_FLG_STATIC_DATA; \
00329     bn_set_max(r); \
00330     }
00331 
00332 #ifdef BN_LLONG
00333 #define mul_add(r,a,w,c) { \
00334     BN_ULLONG t; \
00335     t=(BN_ULLONG)w * (a) + (r) + (c); \
00336     (r)= Lw(t); \
00337     (c)= Hw(t); \
00338     }
00339 
00340 #define mul(r,a,w,c) { \
00341     BN_ULLONG t; \
00342     t=(BN_ULLONG)w * (a) + (c); \
00343     (r)= Lw(t); \
00344     (c)= Hw(t); \
00345     }
00346 
00347 #define sqr(r0,r1,a) { \
00348     BN_ULLONG t; \
00349     t=(BN_ULLONG)(a)*(a); \
00350     (r0)=Lw(t); \
00351     (r1)=Hw(t); \
00352     }
00353 
00354 #elif defined(BN_UMULT_HIGH)
00355 #define mul_add(r,a,w,c) {      \
00356     BN_ULONG high,low,ret,tmp=(a);  \
00357     ret =  (r);         \
00358     high=  BN_UMULT_HIGH(w,tmp);    \
00359     ret += (c);         \
00360     low =  (w) * tmp;       \
00361     (c) =  (ret<(c))?1:0;       \
00362     (c) += high;            \
00363     ret += low;         \
00364     (c) += (ret<low)?1:0;       \
00365     (r) =  ret;         \
00366     }
00367 
00368 #define mul(r,a,w,c)    {       \
00369     BN_ULONG high,low,ret,ta=(a);   \
00370     low =  (w) * ta;        \
00371     high=  BN_UMULT_HIGH(w,ta); \
00372     ret =  low + (c);       \
00373     (c) =  high;            \
00374     (c) += (ret<low)?1:0;       \
00375     (r) =  ret;         \
00376     }
00377 
00378 #define sqr(r0,r1,a)    {       \
00379     BN_ULONG tmp=(a);       \
00380     (r0) = tmp * tmp;       \
00381     (r1) = BN_UMULT_HIGH(tmp,tmp);  \
00382     }
00383 
00384 #else
00385 /*************************************************************
00386  * No long long type
00387  */
00388 
00389 #define LBITS(a)    ((a)&BN_MASK2l)
00390 #define HBITS(a)    (((a)>>BN_BITS4)&BN_MASK2l)
00391 #define L2HBITS(a)  (((a)<<BN_BITS4)&BN_MASK2)
00392 
00393 #define LLBITS(a)   ((a)&BN_MASKl)
00394 #define LHBITS(a)   (((a)>>BN_BITS2)&BN_MASKl)
00395 #define LL2HBITS(a) ((BN_ULLONG)((a)&BN_MASKl)<<BN_BITS2)
00396 
00397 #define mul64(l,h,bl,bh) \
00398     { \
00399     BN_ULONG m,m1,lt,ht; \
00400  \
00401     lt=l; \
00402     ht=h; \
00403     m =(bh)*(lt); \
00404     lt=(bl)*(lt); \
00405     m1=(bl)*(ht); \
00406     ht =(bh)*(ht); \
00407     m=(m+m1)&BN_MASK2; if (m < m1) ht+=L2HBITS((BN_ULONG)1); \
00408     ht+=HBITS(m); \
00409     m1=L2HBITS(m); \
00410     lt=(lt+m1)&BN_MASK2; if (lt < m1) ht++; \
00411     (l)=lt; \
00412     (h)=ht; \
00413     }
00414 #define cav_sqr64(lo,ho,in) \
00415     { \
00416 CVMX_MTM0(in); \
00417 CVMX_MTP2(0);\
00418 CVMX_VMULU(lo,in,0); \
00419 CVMX_VMULU(ho,0,0); \
00420  }
00421 
00422 
00423 #define sqr64(lo,ho,in) \
00424     { \
00425     BN_ULONG l,h,m; \
00426  \
00427     h=(in); \
00428     l=LBITS(h); \
00429     h=HBITS(h); \
00430     m =(l)*(h); \
00431     l*=l; \
00432     h*=h; \
00433     h+=(m&BN_MASK2h1)>>(BN_BITS4-1); \
00434     m =(m&BN_MASK2l)<<(BN_BITS4+1); \
00435     l=(l+m)&BN_MASK2; if (l < m) h++; \
00436     (lo)=l; \
00437     (ho)=h; \
00438     }
00439 
00440 #define mul_add(r,a,bl,bh,c) { \
00441     BN_ULONG l,h; \
00442  \
00443     h= (a); \
00444     l=LBITS(h); \
00445     h=HBITS(h); \
00446     mul64(l,h,(bl),(bh)); \
00447  \
00448     /* non-multiply part */ \
00449     l=(l+(c))&BN_MASK2; if (l < (c)) h++; \
00450     (c)=(r); \
00451     l=(l+(c))&BN_MASK2; if (l < (c)) h++; \
00452     (c)=h&BN_MASK2; \
00453     (r)=l; \
00454     }
00455 #ifdef OCTEON_OPENSSL
00456 #include "cvmx.h"
00457   /*
00458    *      cav_mul_add ()
00459    *      1: Load the multiplier 1
00460    *      2: Load the addition (r)          
00461    *      3: Call VMULU (r{to store the lower 64b},multiplier2,c {add 2nd num})
00462    *      4: VMULU (c,0,0);  to get P2 register in c variable
00463    *      r will have lower 64 bits and c will have higher 64 bits
00464    */
00465 #define cav_mul_add(r,a,bl,bh,c) { \
00466     BN_ULONG b; \
00467     b =  bh<<32 | bl; \
00468     CVMX_MTM0(a); \
00469     CVMX_MTP2(r); \
00470     CVMX_VMULU(r,b,c); \
00471     CVMX_VMULU(c,0,0); \
00472     }
00473 #endif
00474 
00475 #define mul(r,a,bl,bh,c) { \
00476     BN_ULONG l,h; \
00477  \
00478     h= (a); \
00479     l=LBITS(h); \
00480     h=HBITS(h); \
00481     mul64(l,h,(bl),(bh)); \
00482  \
00483     /* non-multiply part */ \
00484     l+=(c); if ((l&BN_MASK2) < (c)) h++; \
00485     (c)=h&BN_MASK2; \
00486     (r)=l&BN_MASK2; \
00487     }
00488 #endif                          /* !BN_LLONG */

00512 #endif
